intro: Dracocephalum origanoides, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, sky-blue to lavender flowers. The plant has aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
